revised_title: Magnetic Declination Phenomena at Kew Observatory, 1890-1900
tldr: The author analyzes the magnetic declination at Kew Observatory from 1890 to 1900, measuring magnetograph curves and diurnal inequalities. The study finds that disturbed days exhibit a distinct regular diurnal variation, and investigates the relationship between absolute ranges and sunspot areas to explore theories on the origin of magnetic storms.
